title: Betelgeuse: A Star on the Brink
summary: A look at the lifecycle and behavior of Betelgeuse, a red supergiant.
content:
Betelgeuse, one of the most studied red supergiants, is known for its unpredictable dimming events.
Located in the constellation of Orion, Betelgeuse began to dim noticeably, starting in October 2019.
Its brightness had dropped by a factor of approximately 3, by mid-February 2020.
It then returned to a more normal brightness range, in April 2023.
The dimming was attributed to a dust cloud formed by a massive ejection of material from the surface of the star, which blocked the radiation and hence caused the dimming.
